contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Young1stViscountChaplin.jpg|thumb|200px|The future first Viscount Chaplin in 1859, aged 18]] '''Viscount Chaplin''', of Saint Oswald's, Blankney, in the County of Lincoln, was a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1916 for [[Henry Chaplin, 1st Viscount Chaplin|Henry Chaplin]], a [[Conservative Party (UK)|Tory]] [[Member of Parliament|MP]], [[Cabinet (government)|cabinet]] [[political minister|minister]], country landowner and racehorse owner. The title became extinct upon the death of his grandson, the third Viscount, in 1981. [[Edith Vane-Tempest-Stewart, Marchioness of Londonderry|Edith Chaplin]], daughter of the first Viscount, married [[Charles Vane-Tempest-Stewart, 7th Marquess of Londonderry]], and became a well-known socialite and philanthropist. [[Edward Chaplin (MP)|Edward Chaplin]], younger brother of the first Viscount, was also a politician. The Chaplin family descended from Sir Francis Chaplin, [[Lord Mayor of London]] from 1677 to 1678. Sir Francis was the father of Robert Chaplin, who was created a [[baronet]] in 1715 (see [[Chaplin baronets]]), and John Chaplin, ancestor of the Viscounts Chaplin. ==Viscounts Chaplin (1916)== *[[Henry Chaplin, 1st Viscount Chaplin]] (1840–1923) *[[Eric Chaplin, 2nd Viscount Chaplin]] (1877–1949) *[[Anthony Chaplin, 3rd Viscount Chaplin]] (1906–1981) ==See also== *[[Chaplin baronets]] ==References== *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chaplin}} [[Category:Viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Extinct viscountcies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]] [[pl:Wicehrabia Chaplin]]
